I am experiencing a similar problem using Eclipse 3.1 . I can't find the 
followowing classes in the plugin source, or even the deprecated plugin source 
(impoorted in the sample in GLScene.java):

import org.eclipse.swt.opengl.GLCanvas
import org.eclipse.swt.opengl.GLData

When I try to create a 3D chart view, I get this error in the Eclipse Log:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/opengl/GLCanvas
	at org.eclipse.swt.examples.openglview.view.GLView.createPartControl
(GLView.java:29)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewReference.createPartHelper
(ViewReference.java:305)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewReference.createPart
(ViewReference.java:180)

Ack, sorry this is unclear.  These classes:

  org.eclipse.swt.opengl.GLData
  org.eclipse.swt.opengl.GLCanvas

are included in SWT from I20050927-0800 and newer.  3.2M3 will be the first
milestone release with this API.  So, they're not included in ogl.jar anymore,
they are now part of SWT itself.  I will try to make this clearer on the webpage
(www.eclipse.org/swt/opengl/).

Let me know if you have trouble!
